definition: to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: You need to know how to use money form other sources to buy real estate with nothing down.
sentences.chinese: 你必須知道從其它地方搞錢，以實現零首付。

sentences.english: Market economy is by no means equal to money making economy.
sentences.chinese: 市場經濟絕不等於“搞錢”經濟。

sentences.english: He got his money in dishonest ways.
sentences.chinese: 他以不正當的方式搞錢。

sentences.english: Rather than get money in such a dishonest way, he would beg in the street.
sentences.chinese: 他寧可沿街乞討，也不願意以如此不正當的手段搞錢。

sentences.english: These people are just interested in making money.
A young man down on his luck might do anything to get money.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人在走黴運的時候可能會不顧一切去搞錢。

sentences.english: Don't get money by dishonest means.
sentences.chinese: 不要用不正當的手段搞錢。
